description: Unique identifier for this meter reading record; serves as the primary key for tracking and linking activities.
Precise date-time when the reading was captured or ingested, typically to milliseconds (YYYYMMDDHHMMSSmmm); used for sequencing and recency checks.
System date the record was last updated, stored as YYYYMMDD; supports audit and synchronization.
Cumulative meter/odometer value for the asset at capture time, expressed in the unit specified by metertype.
Identifier of the originating record that supplied this reading, paired with sourcer to locate the source entity.
Type of source that provided the reading (e.g., fuel transaction, equipment module); used with source to resolve the origin.
Identifier of the equipment/asset to which this meter reading applies; foreign key to the fleet asset registry.
Reference qualifier indicating the target entity/table for the equipment identifier; likely constant in this dataset; confirm with SME.
Unit of measure for the meter reading, such as miles, hours, or kilometers; determines interpretation of meter and elapse_meter.
Key from a prior/legacy system corresponding to this record, enabling cross-system traceability.
Table name in the legacy system where the original record resided; used for migration lineage.
Reference to a work order meter entry that originated this record; may be null when sourced elsewhere; confirm with SME.
Internal processing/status flag controlling whether and how this record should be updated or reconciled; numeric codes require definition; confirm with SME.
Usage accrued since the previous reading for the same asset, calculated as a delta; uses the unit defined by metertype.
Time of day the reading was taken or logged (HHMMSS); may be blank when unknown.
Free-text remarks about the reading, anomalies, or context provided by users or import processes.
